a746c0e9-2968-4cbf-bdd1-4205ed1816a4.short_summary: ğŸš« Pluralsight shares personal data with subprocessors/third parties on instructions; international transfers (EU-US Framework). âš ï¸ Uses cookies; AI processes user content; limited user deletion rights. Data encrypted, least-privilege access.[1][2][7][9] (38 words)
a746c0e9-2968-4cbf-bdd1-4205ed1816a4.full_summary:
# What You Need to Know

## ğŸš« CRITICAL ISSUES (Deal Breakers)
ğŸš« If your boss pays for your account with a work email, they own all your learning data like course history and scores - you lose access if they cut you off  
ğŸš« They record and store your support calls for 6 months, listening to everything you say  
ğŸš« Using a work email lets your employer take full control of your account and see everything in it  

## âš ï¸ CONCERNING PRACTICES (Think Twice)
âš ï¸ They track every click, course view, scroll, and device detail automatically when you use the site  
âš ï¸ Your data gets shared with partners, affiliates, tech vendors, and even Facebook for ads and analytics  
âš ï¸ Data moves to the US from anywhere (like Europe) and they use legal tricks to make it "safe"  
âš ï¸ AI features can make up fake info or risky advice - don't trust it for real work  
âš ï¸ They keep your data forever after you quit, for lawsuits or complaints  
âš ï¸ Cookies follow you around other sites for targeted ads unless you opt out  

## âœ… GOOD THINGS (Your Rights)
âœ… You can delete all your personal data anytime through account settings - it's gone for good  
âœ… Opt out of marketing emails and some ad tracking via your profile or unsubscribe link  
âœ… EU/UK users get full GDPR rights like seeing, fixing, or erasing your data  
âœ… California users have CCPA rights to know and control data sales  
âœ… They encrypt payments and call recordings, with limited staff access  

## â„¹ï¸ STANDARD STUFF (Normal for Most Services)
â„¹ï¸ Need name and email to sign up; payment info for subscriptions  
â„¹ï¸ They send service updates and can't be opted out of those  
â„¹ï¸ Cookies run the site - disable them and features break  
â„¹ï¸ Third-party payment processors handle your card details, not them  
â„¹ï¸ They use your data to suggest courses and improve the site

06f9eff8-52c9-460b-a756-118df0c3c02b.short_summary: ğŸš« OpenAI collects **prompts, files, IP, device data**; shares with affiliates/sub-processors. âš ï¸ May retain 30 days for safety/abuse; uses de-identified data for improvements. No training on business data unless opted in. Users have access/delete rights.[2][1][5] (38 words)
06f9eff8-52c9-460b-a756-118df0c3c02b.full_summary:
# What You Need to Know

## ğŸš« CRITICAL ISSUES (Deal Breakers)
ğŸš« They keep your chats, prompts, files, images, and audio to train their AI unless you opt out.
ğŸš« A court order forces them to save all ChatGPT conversations forever, even deleted or temporary ones from April-September 2025[1][2].
ğŸš« Bosses in business accounts can read your private chats and control your account.
ğŸš« They track your IP address, device info, location, and exact usage to watch for "fraud" or improve their stuff.
ğŸš« If the company sells or goes bankrupt, your data goes to the new owners.

## âš ï¸ CONCERNING PRACTICES (Think Twice)
âš ï¸ They share your data with vendors, affiliates, and government if law says so or to fight "abuse."
âš ï¸ Your "deleted" temporary chats stick around 30 days for safety checks.
âš ï¸ AI outputs can lie about you or facts, and fixing model errors is hard.
âš ï¸ No jury trialsâ€”disputes go to private arbitration in California, no class actions.
âš ï¸ Under 13 banned; under 18 needs parent okay, but they don't check age well.

## âœ… GOOD THINGS (Your Rights)
âœ… You own your inputs and outputs, and they assign any rights to you.
âœ… Opt out of them using your content for AI training via settings.
âœ… Ask to see, delete, fix, or download your data at privacy.openai.com or dsar@openai.com.
âœ… They don't sell your data or use it for targeted ads.
âœ… Cancel paid account anytime, no refunds unless law requires.

## â„¹ï¸ STANDARD STUFF (Normal for Most Services)
â„¹ï¸ Cookies track your browsing to run the site and remember logins.
â„¹ï¸ Must be 13+ to sign up with real info; no sharing accounts.
â„¹ï¸ They use data to fight spam, fix bugs, and send updates.
â„¹ï¸ Security measures in place, but no online service is 100% hack-proof.
â„¹ï¸ Policy can change with 30 days notice for big stuff.

a05117f3-1739-4ded-b6d2-836e182f1cf3.short_summary: ğŸš« GitHub collects extensive personal and usage data (account, content, device, cookies, payment) and may share with third parties, subprocessors, affiliates, and law enforcement when required.âš ï¸ Data is used for service, security, analytics, and AI training; you can access, correct, delete, or export data but some processing relies on consent or legitimate interests.
a05117f3-1739-4ded-b6d2-836e182f1cf3.full_summary:
# What You Need to Know

## ğŸš« CRITICAL ISSUES (Deal Breakers)
ğŸš« You must be 13 or older - kids under 13 get accounts deleted right away  
ğŸš« GitHub can read your private repo code for security scans, support, or if they think it's breaking laws  
ğŸš« By posting public code, you let everyone copy and use it forever through forks  

## âš ï¸ CONCERNING PRACTICES (Think Twice)
âš ï¸ They get a permanent license to store, copy, and show your code to run their service  
âš ï¸ GitHub staff can access your private repos without asking for security checks or legal reasons  
âš ï¸ If you use AI tools like Copilot, your code might train their models unless you opt out  
âš ï¸ No refunds if you cancel mid-payment, and they keep backups of your data for 90 days  
âš ï¸ They can change terms anytime and suspend your account for any reason  

## âœ… GOOD THINGS (Your Rights)
âœ… You own your code and can delete your account anytime  
âœ… Private repos are treated as confidential and protected like their own secrets  
âœ… You can ask for a copy of your data before they delete it after cancellation  
âœ… You control who sees your private repos and can add licenses to public ones  
âœ… They notify you 30 days before big changes like price hikes  

## â„¹ï¸ STANDARD STUFF (Normal for Most Services)
â„¹ï¸ You need a real email and can't share logins or make bot accounts  
â„¹ï¸ They use cookies and track usage to improve the site  
â„¹ï¸ No phone support - only email and in-app help  
â„¹ï¸ You pay taxes on fees, and late payments add interest  
â„¹ï¸ They can end service if you break rules like spam or illegal stuff
